job_description:
WHO WE ARE:
Based in Mississauga, Canada, and deployed globally, Invafresh is a leading technology company specializing in FreshologyTM software solutions for supermarket & boutique fresh food grocers around the world. In business since 1988, Invafresh continues to invest in its people and technology. Today, Invafresh is an organization of experienced and retail-savvy FreshologistsTM equipped with industry specific solutions that supermarket chains can leverage to succeed in the field of fresh operations.

Our fresh food retail operations solutions are deployed collectively in over 25,000 grocery stores worldwide, actively supporting the in-store execution of fresh operations. We enable our customers to achieve and maintain a leadership position in their fresh food offering by providing data integrity and decision support tools needed to enhance sales, reduce shrink and inventories, and improve overall margins while positively impacting the planet by reducing food waste throughout the supply chain of fresh food retail. We help our customers achieve success in the highly competitive grocery market.

Our mission is clear. Build long lasting partnerships with grocery retailers and enable them to achieve Operational Excellence in Fresh. To us, this represents putting all our energy into helping our customers maximize financial performance so they can achieve top quartile operating metrics. The ultimate goal is to deliver a fresh offering that exceeds the expectations of the consumer.

THE ROLE:
The Application Performance Engineer is a permanent full-time position reporting to the Director of Software Engineering.
The Performance Test Engineer will play a key role in our global Cloud and on-prem solution support for Invafresh’s products and customers. This is a complete hands-on Application Performance Engineer role.

WHAT YOU’LL BE DOING:
As a performance engineer, your task will be to performance profile and then develop strategies to increase the performance and reliability of our solutions. You will be responsible for holistic application profiling and optimization - from identifying performance bottlenecks, through writing tools, to optimizations at the level of application protocol and data layer. In addition to profiling and optimizations, you will be responsible for the design and development of our optimization framework, setting up a test environment, utilizing automation tools to load applications under stress and measure performance, and conducting system performance testing to ensure system reliability, capacity and scalability.

ABOUT YOU
Passionate about performance profiling and optimization across multi-tier architectures.
You have a solid understanding of performance tuning and efficiently work with various profiling tools to identify performance bottlenecks.
You understand how to design performance testing, execute performance tests and capture detailed test outcomes and all information needed to support ongoing measurements and reporting on risks, defects, tests, and coverage.
You have robust software design and development skills.
You have a solid understanding of performance testing types such as Stress, Spike, Load, Volume, and Scalability.
Desire to lead, be accountable, and take the initiative and ability to work independently and in a team
You have a problem-solving mentality leveraging internal and external resources, with exceptional verbal and written communication.
Excellent communication and listening skills.
Excellent oral and written presentation skills.
Good social interaction with the immediate team as well as other teams.
Ability to work effectively in a dynamic environment with changing needs and requirements

EXPERIENCE & QUALIFICATIONS
Bachelor’s degree in computer science or equivalent experience required.
5+ years of experience analyzing the performance of complex software in traditional on-prem and cloud deployments and improving the reliability of software applications and IT systems.
Expert in designing, developing and executing performance test automation using JMeter, LoadRunner, Selenium, SoapUI, etc.
5+ years of experience in automation, framework design and performance testing with CI/CD integration of load tool / Azure DevOps.
Expert in developing test plans, test scripts, test scenarios/cases, and coverage metrics for test performance automation.
Have experience in a wide variety of programming languages - C++, Java, API’s is an asset
Strong skills to identify any potential performance issues, debugging, performance optimization and providing solutions to fix any bottlenecks.
Good Understanding of Process API and tooling on Windows (Process Counters, Sets, Producer, Consumers, Windows Performance Toolkit)
Hands-on experience with functional tests, non-functional tests and systems/applications level integration tests
Experience evaluating performance across both applications, network (HTTP/1/2/3, TCP/IP, UDP), infrastructure and data layers
Experience with observability using Application Performance Monitoring (APM) using Azure
Experience with test data creation, Test Data Management (TDM)
Experience with database technologies and analysis
Experience with Cloud infrastructure (Azure)
Ability to develop tools where existing tools don’t exist
Solid understanding of Processes/Threads on Windows, Linux or OSX etc.
Good Understanding of data collection practices, statistical modelling and tooling (Correlation coefficient, Poison distribution, Little's Law, har, collectd, statsd, gnuplot)
Understanding of BPF and BPF based performance tooling

WHY INVAFRESH?
Competitive compensation, flex hours and a comprehensive benefits package
We take great pride in our first-class team and culture. Open-door approach at all levels.
Entrepreneurial and rapid growth company with essentially zero employee turnover
The premium and most progressive product on the market. Focus on continuous innovation.
Work hard/Play hard mentality; we thrive on change and continuously strive for excellence.
Real-time coaching and feedback, growth opportunities, and a supportive and collaborative team
